Description: Limestone stela: roughly-shaped limestone stela similar, with a rounded top and broken base, bearing the name Meresham with a seated female figure determinative. The inscription is carved in low relief.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tomb of Semerkhet, subsidiary grave
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' I, pl.XXXI, 35; pl.XXXV, 35; British Museum, 'Hieroglyphic Texts from Egyptian Stelae, etc'., I (London), pl.1; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit I (Wiesbaden, 1963), 182, 498.
